body: We now send each peer in a single packet instead of the entire peer list in one big packet. This removes a theoretical hard limit on the number of peers that can join a group and ensures that the maximum packet size doesn't exceed the MTU of common network media. Some unnecessary syncing logic was removed. This will increase the aggressiveness of syncing with more redundancy, but should improve overall syncing speed. Additionally, the ping packet now contains a checksum of the public key hash of all confirmed peers instead of just the peer count. This will ensure that sync requests will be made in the case that all group peers have the same peer count, but a different set of peers (i.e. group splits). Finally - an unused 32-bit uint was removed from the sync request packet. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1539)

comment_data.body: What is the naming convention? What does gcc stand for and what does gc stand for?

gc -> groupchat, gcc -> groupchat connection, gca -> groupchat announce

All the gcc functions reside in group_connection, all the gc functions reside in group_chats, and all the gca functions reside in group_announce.

commit.message:
Refactor peer syncing

We now send each peer in a single packet instead of the entire
peer list in one big packet. This removes a theoretical hard
limit on the number of peers that can join a group and ensures
that the maximum packet size doesn't exceed the MTU of common
network media.

Some unnecessary syncing logic was removed. This will increase
the aggressiveness of syncing with more redundancy, but should
improve overall syncing speed.

Additionally, the ping packet now contains a checksum of the
public key hash of all confirmed peers instead of just the peer
count. This will ensure that sync requests will be made in
the case that all group peers have the same peer count, but a
different set of peers (i.e. group splits).

Finally - an unused 32-bit uint was removed from the sync request
packet.

We now send each peer in a single packet instead of the entire
peer list in one big packet. This removes a theoretical hard

Some unnecessary syncing logic was removed. This will increase
the aggressiveness of syncing with more redundancy, but should
improve overall syncing speed.

Additionally, the ping packet now contains a checksum of the
public key hash of all confirmed peers instead of just the peer
count. This will ensure that sync requests will be made in
the case that all group peers have the same peer count, but a
different set of peers (i.e. group splits).

Finally - an unused 32-bit uint was removed from the sync request
packet.

commit.message:
Use flags to tell peers what info we want in a sync response.

Previously a sync response was very wasteful in that all group
info was sent to the peer making the request, including info
that they didn't need
